title: User Calculator Navigation and Usage
description: Verify that a user can use the dynamic dropdown menu on the home page to select and open calculators for Civil, Electrical, and HVAC service modules without errors.

steps.description: Navigate to the home page.
Verify that the dynamic dropdown menu is present and lists calculators for Civil, Electrical, and HVAC modules.
Select a calculator from the Civil module in the dropdown.
Verify that the selected Civil calculator page opens successfully and displays the calculator interface.
Use the calculator with valid inputs to perform a calculation.
Check that the calculator returns correct results and no errors occur.
Repeat the selection and usage for Electrical and HVAC calculators.
Verify each calculator loads and functions correctly.

title: Theme Management - Upload and Validation
description: Ensure administrators can upload new themes which are validated against the system's criteria before activation.

steps.description: Navigate to /admin/themes as an authenticated administrator.
Upload a valid new theme package file.
Verify the theme upload completes successfully and the validation process runs.
Confirm that the theme passes all validation checks including manifest and required files.
Upload a corrupted or invalid theme package.
Verify that the validation fails and an appropriate error message is displayed without corrupting the system.

title: Theme Management - Activate and Dynamic CSS Application
description: Validate that activating a new theme updates the UI dynamically with correct CSS styles applied.

steps.description: Upload and validate a new theme.
Activate the new theme.
Verify the theme is marked as active in the system.
Navigate to the user-facing pages.
Confirm the UI reflects the new theme styles with dynamic CSS applied correctly.
Modify theme settings and customize CSS.
Verify that changes to theme customization update the UI styling in real-time without errors.

title: Plugin Management - Upload, Validation, Activation Toggle, and Deletion
description: Ensure administrators can upload plugins, plugins pass manifest validation, toggle activation state, and delete plugins correctly.

steps.description: Navigate to the plugin management page as an administrator.
Upload a valid plugin package.
Verify plugin is uploaded successfully and the manifest file is validated for compatibility.
Toggle activation on the uploaded plugin.
Verify plugin activation state changes and reflects accordingly in the UI and system modules.
Toggle activation off.
Delete the uploaded plugin.
Verify the plugin is removed from the system with no residual files or errors.
Attempt to upload a plugin with an invalid manifest file.
Verify that the upload is rejected and a detailed error message is shown.

title: Modular Service Provider Navigation
description: Verify that navigation modules for Civil, Electrical, and HVAC service providers exist and link to appropriate calculators.

steps.description: Access the home page.
Confirm presence of distinct navigation areas or dropdown entries for Civil, Electrical, and HVAC modules.
Select each module and verify that navigation routes to the correct calculator pages.
Check that the calculators specific to each service provider module load without errors.

title: Backup and Restore System Functionality
description: Test the creation, download, and restoration of full system backups including database dumps, theme, and plugin data.

steps.description: Navigate to /admin/help as an administrator.
Initiate a full system backup.
Verify backup completes successfully, including db.sql and assets.
Download the created backup file.
Verify the backup file can be downloaded without corruption and contains all critical data.
Restore system from the backup file.
Confirm system is restored to the exact previous state without data loss and calculators, themes, and plugins work as before.

title: Audit Log Viewer - Filtering and Download
description: Verify that the audit log viewer supports filtering by criteria and can download filtered log entries properly.

steps.description: Navigate to /admin/audit-logs.
Apply filters such as date range, user, and event type.
Verify that the audit logs displayed match the filtering criteria.
Download the filtered audit log entries.
Confirm the downloaded file contains correctly filtered logs and is not corrupted.

title: Admin POST Routes - Rate Limiting and CSRF Protection
description: Ensure administrative POST routes are protected by rate limiting and CSRF tokens to prevent abuse and unauthorized requests.

steps.description: Attempt to submit a POST request to an admin route without a valid CSRF token.
Verify the request is rejected with a CSRF validation error.
Submit a series of valid POST requests rapidly to an admin route to trigger rate limiting.
Confirm that after a threshold, further requests receive rate limit error responses.
Submit valid POST requests with correct CSRF tokens within rate limits.
Verify the requests complete successfully without rate limiting or CSRF errors.

title: Logging and Audit Logging Integration
description: Verify that system events and administrative actions are logged properly with structured logs and audit-specific records.

steps.description: Trigger general system events such as user logins and calculator usage.
Confirm structured logs are created with necessary details for each event.
Perform administrative actions such as theme activation and backup creation.
Check that audit logs capture these actions with required metadata and timestamps.

title: API v1 Endpoints - Health, Calculators, and History
description: Verify API endpoints return correct status codes and data formats, with the /api/v1/health endpoint consistently responding with a 200 OK JSON response.

steps.description: Send GET request to /api/v1/health.
Verify the response status is 200 OK and the payload is valid JSON confirming system health.
Send GET requests to /api/v1/calculators for available calculators.
Verify the response includes accurate calculator metadata in correct JSON format.
Request /api/v1/history for user calculation history.
Ensure the response returns properly structured JSON with relevant history data.
Send malformed or unauthorized API requests.
Confirm the API provides appropriate error status codes and informative messages.
